pros: Friendly staff, nice people and pleasant place to work
cons: Not as many resources as larger hospital but still treat many patients.

pros: It feels that the company really cares for you.
cons: Training in specific jobs could be a lot better and have more time with with a seasoned manager related to your job.

pros: Engaged leadership, good pay/benefits, wellness programs, advancement opportunities.
cons: Staffing can be a challenge as the location is an hour from urban areas where many physicians want to be. Turnover has occurred.

job_title: RN PCU in Milton Keynes, England
pros: Faith-based hospital, flexible hours, and good manager (depending on the floor)
cons: Pay is low compared to Atlanta metropolitan area; sometimes, the working environment can be discouraging

pros: The work environment and culture is great! My work team cares about patients and each other. I appreciate the transparency from the Lab leaders as well as hospital execs.
cons: It appears other local hospital systems invest more in growth initiatives.

pros: Education opportunities, tuition reimbursement, advancement opportunities
cons: Low salary, strict pay practices, do more with less.

pros:
-manager is really nice
-small hospital so easy to navigate
-flexible rules
cons:
-low pay compared to other hospitals
-understaffed

job_title: Certified Surgical Technologist in Calhoun, GA
pros: the workload was about average.
cons: The pay is substantially less compared to other hospitals within a 30-minute drive.

pros: They have great values and treat you like family. They provide opportunities that other organizations may not. They are beginning to offer some really great work flexibility. You'll gain valuable experience hands down.
cons: The fast pace isn't conducive to thoughtful design, and traditional practices often outweigh innovative thinking.

pros: Work is Reliable, 26 Days of Paid Time Off, Benefits, Friendship, Close to home, Hours
cons: Work is reliable but pay is extremely weak. Work pile continues to grow and you are expected to manage it all without compensation. 26 PDO days and 12 of them are Mandatory holidays off (you cannot opt for no pay, you are forced to use PDO). No growth.

pros: Faith based organization with a great vision for patient centered care
cons: Insurance and medical care can be pricey

review_title: Best in area to work for as a clinic physician
job_title: Physician, Family Practice in Chatsworth, GA
pros: Let’s physicians practice as individuals. Although we are monitored closely as far as face to face time with patients we are not forced to see a certain number of patients per hour. I schedule one patient per 30 minutes, unheard of in most primary care practices.
cons: It takes a long time to get changes done. Large corporate structure. Religious overtones that could be either a positive or negative dependent on employee background.

pros: growing, take care of employees, RVU based
cons: underpay, bureaucracy, to much QI, RVU based

pros: Great coworkers and a great facility.
cons: Not much pay for techs, and not really any raises either.

pros: I enjoy the environment, I love helping other people and that it’s a faith based hospital
cons: Working holidays can be bothering some

review_title: Gordon Hospital An Asset to the Adventist Health System
pros: Team work is a priority.  For the most part the employees are supportive, helpful and excellent to work with.  The atmosphere is one of caring.  The different units pull together to work for the best outcome for our patients. The hospital tries very hard to meet the community needs and to grow in different specialty areas.
cons: If you do have a concern and you take it to your immediate supervisor, the problem is not kept confidential.  The work schedules do not accomodate family holidays; however, if you have a family problem the management is very accomodating.

pros:
The employees are friendly, some really care and want to make a difference. 
The community needs the care that is provided by the hospital.
cons:
Board of Directors are small town egotist that will run the hospital in to the ground. 
Low pay, board thinks they can hire professional at mill worker pay.
There is a general sense among staff and community that the hospital is failing that permeates every aspect of the hospital.
There are employees that have worked there whole life there and they are not going to update processes and procedures despite evidence of better processes.

pros: I have been working with AdventHealth Gordon for over a year but have worked with the organization over 5 years. AdventHealth Gordon is a great place if you are looking for a family oriented environment. The culture of the organization is second to none. They care for the employees just as much as they do the customer/patient. Senior leadership values the opinion of the front line staff and offer many opportunities for growth and development.
cons: Nothing worth mentioning at this time.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Calhoun, GA
pros: They had fair benefits packages. They paid on time every pay period.
cons: They promote within their religion and mainly outsiders who are young get the good jobs. They pester employees constantly to give to charity and then took credit in the local paper. They pay low.  During the times when the hospital is being surveyed they go insane trying to make sure employees give them the highest possible ratings yet when yearly raises are due they give you as little as possible saying nobody deserves high ratings, everyone needs to improve.

review_title: Great  place to work they care about their employees and even more for their patients
pros: They care for they whole needs of patient and their family and community .Employees are treated great and like family . You are expected to have a positive attitude and treat everyone with respect  and you are treated likewise. I would recommend employment to anyone with a caring positive attitude you will be blessed .
cons: None I can think of

job_title: Regional Supply Chain Director in Calhoun, GA
pros: Leadership is very engaged and supportive. Organization culture is very positive. Mission of the organization, Extending the Healing Ministry of Christ, permeates the actions/decisions of daily operations. Staff are truly passionate about the work they do.
cons: As with any organization, there is always opportunities for improvement. However, there are none worth mentioning here that would deter me from recommending a friend from considering employment.

pros: They are very big on teamwork.  They have a family type environment. They offer traing and they pay for travel, room and board expenses.
cons: Their starting salaries are lower than other hospitals. They need to improve their method of gaining equipment, instruments and supplies to the OR.

review_title: Murray Medical Center has been a good place to work.
pros: I like working here because it is close to home. I've always thought helping in the community was better than working outside.
cons: Small town politics play a big role. Everyone took a pay cut to help offset a large debt so the hospital could be more manageable.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Calhoun, GA
pros: AdventHealth Gordon is a wonderful place to work!  It has a great atmosphere, and the people you work with are just like family!  I love that I can pray with my patients and extend the healing ministry of Christ to my patients on a daily basis.
cons: It would be nice if the pay was a little more competitive to other surrounding hospitals.

pros: Gordon is a small hospital with a family type atmosphere. Environment is low pressure and low stress for the most part.
cons: Gordon is a church-based non profit hospital. As such advancement seems to be proffered on those who are a part of the church.

review_title: Great Work Environment, but Compensation Could be Better
job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Calhoun, GA
pros:
Positive Work Environment
Friendly Employees throughout facility 
Great sense of community
cons:
Health care benefits could be better - deductibles can be too high 
Pay for hourly workers is on the lower end of the scale
Room for growth is not always available 
Paid time off system is not the best - holidays are not paid separately, but taken from earned PTO.

pros: Competitive pay, plenty of career opportunities
cons: Management is creating a "backstabbing environment" management does not appreciate  good employees. Some employees get away with everything and others stay in trouble.

pros: The work environment is really positive and fosters a strong community of educational experiences. People take time to mentor and encourage you. The small hospital provides a family like atmosphere and allows you to network with many people.
cons: Calhoun, where the hospital is located, is a bit far from larger cities such as Chattanooga and Atlanta.

pros: I love working at a faith based facility.  Knowing my co-workers are always there to pray with me and for me is a great feeling.  I love what I do.  It's fast paced and never any down time!
cons: Like all jobs there are times I feel overwhelmed.

review_title: great place to work all around
pros: Everyone there is great to work with, competitive benefits package
cons: Food, low pay, rigidity to change

pros: Faith based organization. Great leadership - mission focused. Caring, friendly, positive work environment .
cons: None that I encounter that are worth mentioning.  I always recommend AdventHealth Gordon as a great place to work.

pros: Good benefits and discounts.  Rapid growth means the company is doing well.
cons: Favoritism is a problem.  Too lean-hire more people to accommodate the growth and to keep staff happy and not overworked and overly stressed.

job_title: Emergency Department RN in Chatsworth, GA
pros: Everyone treats you as if you were family. The team work is incredible! The administration really cares about their employees.
cons: More staffing on hand would be nice but that's everywhere you go.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Calhoun, GA
pros: Everyone is generally nice, the hospital works to take care of most of it's employees.
cons: Very cliquey, a lot of managers play favorites.

pros: Salaries , location, cleanliness,always had medical supplies on our unit
cons: Poor management, upper and middle, if your were not in the click, you got the worse of everything

pros: people is really friendly and respectful
cons: some times they were many discharges and we had to stay over but it was not often really

pros: I learned alot about billing, emr systems, injections, and working in both front and back office. Learned how to process specimens through different companies
cons: office unorganized, pay does not match job description, and hours cut, no insurance, no overtime being paid

review_title: AdventHealth Gordon cares about its patients and community.
pros: Christian faith based, growth opportunity, comparable wages.
cons: I can not think of any cons.

review_title: Great Organization Has Positive Mission Values, Faith Based
pros: Great organization to work for.
cons: To much online education that could be simplified.

pros: Faith based organization is awesome
cons: Must have  24/7 coverage for work and holidays

pros: Able to openly pray
cons: Work weekends and the rest is ok
